alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 2:47PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Huerfano County through 315 PM MDT... At 246 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over eastern Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastern Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft
